definitions.definition: An account of real or fictional events .
examples: The book tells the story of two roommates.
You’ve been telling stories again, haven’t you?

definitions.definition: ( US , colloquial , usually pluralized ) A soap opera .
examples: What will she do without being able to watch her stories ?

definitions.definition: A sequence of events, or a situation , such as might be related in an account.
examples: I tried it again; same story , no error message, nothing happened.
The images it captured help tell a story of extreme loss: 25 percent of its ice and four of its 19 glaciers have disappeared since 1957.

definitions.definition: ( social media , sometimes capitalized ) A chronological collection of pictures or short videos published by a user on an application or website that is typically only available for a short period.

main_definition: An account of real or fictional events .
secondary_definitions: ( US , colloquial , usually pluralized ) A soap opera .
A sequence of events, or a situation , such as might be related in an account.
( social media , sometimes capitalized ) A chronological collection of pictures or short videos published by a user on an application or website that is typically only available for a short period.

examples: Our shop was on the fourth story of the building, so we had to install an elevator.

main_definition: ( chiefly US , Philippines ) Alternative spelling of storey .
